line.comment: * LU Update (Solarahawk): upgraded merge arrays code to join arrays comand
* LU Update (Solarahawk): removed Player code

line.text: '%s * B E G I N N * Wing: %s, engage range: %s, bomber: %s '

line.comment: * Get target array according task
* Get attack preference and static texts, define flags and allowed classes
* Attack preference (0 = no preference, 1 = fighters, 2 = capitals)
* Enemy search
* Get reference ship for distance measurement. If the wingleader is docked or does not exist, THIS will be the reference ship
* Define setup arrays
* If we do not have any targets left, make the ones valid that are already fed up with missiles -> raise of effectiveness by reemployment of otherwise jobless wings
* If some preference is set, and no preferred ship is to be found, restart search with no preference. Else return wing home, once no enemy is to be detected
* Sort enemy array dependent on their distance to leader, then reverse the array

line.text: '%sAll visible enemy ships sorted by distance to %s:'

line.comment: * Calculate wing's attack strength (bomber wings are counted 3 times more effective than normal wings)
* Check ship by ship in found enemy ship array, beginning with nearest foe to leader
* Get max attack strength enemy ship ought to be attacked
* Raise max attack strength enemy ship ought to be attacked, if this is a bomber wing (just in case enemy ship is already fed up with normal wings)
* Get attack strength enemy ship is already attacked

line.text: '%sEnemy %s should be attacked with a force of max %s. Is currently attacked with a force of %s.'

line.comment: * Choose ship not yet being attacked with max attack strength
* If enemy ship is attacked with max force, start 5 minutes counter. If ship then still exists, reset counter to 0

line.text: '%sEnemy %s is choosen for wing %s as target, and is now attacked with a force of %s.'

line.comment: * Bombers are to be assigned only huge ships
* If some preference is set, and no preferred ship is to be found, restart search with no preference, else end script
* In case there is no valid target, but still enemy ships awaiting their doom by incomming missiles, return skipped array; prevents wings from docking as long as there are still enemies around
* Lets filter found enemy array, only ships meeting all conditions will be added to the visible enemies array (all enemy ships this wing will choose from)
* If a preference is given, filter all ships not belonging to preferred classes
* If an engage range is given, only take enemy ships into account within given engage range
* In case this is not a bomber wing, and target is currently 'fed up' with fighters, proceed to next target
* Do not target drones, concentrate on larger enemies, drones will get destroyed anyway
* If a target is 'fed up' with missiles, proceed to next target; memory skipped targets
* NPC carriers search for non foe ships also (setting of relations between NPC races and ships is tricky!)

line.text: '%s%s is removed because it is not a foe.'

line.comment: * If meeting all conditions, add enemy ship to visible enemy array

sval.val: Ads.get.valid.target @
%s * B E G I N N * Wing: %s, engage range: %s, bomber: %s
%sSearching for valid targets in sector %s
%sAttack preference: %s
%sLeader of wing %s: %s
%sNumber of all visible enemy ships: %s
%sAll visible enemy ships sorted by distance to %s:
%s%s distance: %s m
%sEnemy %s should be attacked with a force of max %s. Is currently attacked with a force of %s.
%sEnemy %s is choosen for wing %s as target, and is now attacked with a force of %s.
%sNO TARGET FOUND, repeat search?
%s%s is removed because it is not a foe.
LU Update (Solarahawk): upgraded merge arrays code to join arrays comand
LU Update (Solarahawk): removed Player code
Get target array according task
Get attack preference and static texts, define flags and allowed classes
Attack preference (0 = no preference, 1 = fighters, 2 = capitals)
Enemy search
Get reference ship for distance measurement. If the wingleader is docked or does not exist, THIS will be the reference ship
Define setup arrays
If we do not have any targets left, make the ones valid that are already fed up with missiles -> raise of effectiveness by reemployment of otherwise jobless wings
If some preference is set, and no preferred ship is to be found, restart search with no preference. Else return wing home, once no enemy is to be detected
Sort enemy array dependent on their distance to leader, then reverse the array
Calculate wing's attack strength (bomber wings are counted 3 times more effective than normal wings)
Check ship by ship in found enemy ship array, beginning with nearest foe to leader
Get max attack strength enemy ship ought to be attacked
Raise max attack strength enemy ship ought to be attacked, if this is a bomber wing (just in case enemy ship is already fed up with normal wings)
Get attack strength enemy ship is already attacked
Choose ship not yet being attacked with max attack strength
If enemy ship is attacked with max force, start 5 minutes counter. If ship then still exists, reset counter to 0
Bombers are to be assigned only huge ships
If some preference is set, and no preferred ship is to be found, restart search with no preference, else end script
In case there is no valid target, but still enemy ships awaiting their doom by incomming missiles, return skipped array; prevents wings from docking as long as there are still enemies around
Lets filter found enemy array, only ships meeting all conditions will be added to the visible enemies array (all enemy ships this wing will choose from)
If a preference is given, filter all ships not belonging to preferred classes
If an engage range is given, only take enemy ships into account within given engage range
In case this is not a bomber wing, and target is currently 'fed up' with fighters, proceed to next target
Do not target drones, concentrate on larger enemies, drones will get destroyed anyway
If a target is 'fed up' with missiles, proceed to next target; memory skipped targets
NPC carriers search for non foe ships also (setting of relations between NPC races and ships is tricky!)
If meeting all conditions, add enemy ship to visible enemy array
